header.title: CosNotifyChannelAdmin_ProxyPullConsumer

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosNotifyChannelAdmin::ProxyPullConsumer interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosNotification/include/*.hrl").
This module also exports the functions described in:

func.name: connect_any_pull_supplier(ProxyPullConsumer, PullSupplier) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Connect a supplier to the proxy

desc.p: This operation connects the given PullSupplier to the target object. If a client is already connected the AlreadyConnected exception will be raised. The client must support the operations pull and try_pull, otherwise the TypeError exception is raised.

func.name: suspend_connection(ProxyPullConsumer) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Suspend the connection between the client and the proxy

desc.p: If we want to temporarily suspend the connection with the target object this operation must be sued. If the connection already have been suspended or no client have been connected an exception is raised.

func.name: resume_connection(ProxyPullConsumer) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Resume a previously suspended connection with the proxy

desc.p: If The connection have been suspended earlier we can invoke this operation to reinstate the connection. If the connection already is active or no client have been connected to the target object an exception is raised.

func.name: disconnect_pull_consumer(ProxyPullConsumer) -> ok
func.fsummary: Close the connection and terminate the proxy

desc.p: Invoking this operation disconnects the client from the target object which then terminates and inform its administrative parent.
